channel.title: New Zealand Programming Contest
channel.description: Recent content on New Zealand Programming Contest

item.title: Contest Registration
item.description: The contest for this year is over. Reservation is closed until next year. Contest Documentation Contest rules Registration Guide - School Teams Registration Guide - Tertiary Teams Registration Guide - Open Category Teams

item.title: Contest Registration
item.description: The New Zealand Programming Contest is today, 14:00 to 19:00. Useful Information for Contest Day Local Site Information Links are on this page. Welcome Video Useful for those new to the contest Use this link. DOMjudge judging system Use this link Team Entry Form Form to record information to register your team Practice Contest Link to the Practice Problem Set Contest Documentation Contest rules Registration Guide - School Teams

item.title: Contest sites
item.description: Site details for the 2024 contest are listed below. Look out for changes before the contest. Use the URL to find out details, or email the site director. SiteHostSite DirectorExternal URL Auckland University of Auckland Rajko Nenadov Auckland Local Page Hamilton University of Waikato Tom Levy Hamilton Local Page Wellington Whitireia New Zealand (Petone Campus) Chalinor Baliuag Whitireia Local Page Christchurch University of Canterbury Richard Lobb Christchurch Local Page Dunedin University of Otago David Eyers Dunedin Local Page Invercargill James Hargest College Sarah Greeff Invercargill Local Page

item.title: Contest categories
item.description: Notes If team members are not in the same category, then the team must enter in the highest category of the members. Entry fees do NOT apply for an on-line contest. Category Description Entry Fee School Team members must all attend a secondary school in New Zealand. This includes a home school. $30 Tertiary Junior Usually first year university students. Have not started any second year papers. $75 Tertiary Intermediate Usually second year university students.

item.title: About the contest
item.description: The NZPC is an annual contest, usually held in August or September, and open to all programmers in New Zealand. Teams from outside New Zealand may usually enter the ANZAC League which runs at the same time and uses the same problem set. Categories There are 5 categories under which teams may compete, each category having its own winner. The categories range from school pupils to professional programmers. Category Details

item.title: New Zealand Programming Contest
item.description: Welcome to the New Zealand Programming Contest Website The 2023 contest will be held on Saturday August 19th at 2pm. Registration (reservation of places) is open. Information about NZPC Sites Contest Information Registration News on Facebook

item.title: New Zealand Programming Contest
item.description: The New Zealand Programming Contest is this Saturday, 14:00 to 19:00. Information for Contest Day. item.title: New Zealand Programming Contest 2021 Results
item.description: The contest this year was held entirely online because of the outbreak of the Delta Variant of Covid-19. item.title: New Zealand Programming Contest 2023 Results
item.description: The contest was held on Saturday 19th August. Category Winners Scoreboard School squad team,  Rangitoto College - team School Scoreboard Tertiary Junior Among, University of Auckland - team Tertiary Junior Scoreboard Tertiary Intermediate hmm, University of Canterbury - team Tertiary Intermediate Scoreboard Tertiary Open prog4pain, University of Canterbury - team Tertiary Open Scoreboard Open Griffin Practice,  - team Open Scoreboard Contest Problems Contest Statistics   Editorials: 3 and 10 points |  30 points |  100 points
